abstract: The Federal Reserve and other central banks significantly escalated aid to improve liquidity.
snippet: The Federal Reserve and other central banks significantly escalated aid to improve liquidity.
lead_paragraph: Reflecting concerns about the health of the global financial system, the Federal Reserve and the world’s other major central banks significantly escalated their assistance to global markets on Thursday, making almost $200 billion available after bank lending came to a near halt and threatened the global economy.

headline.main: Fed Offers $180 Billion for Ailing Money Markets
headline.print_headline: Central Banks Unite to Aid Global Money Markets

byline.original: By Matthew Saltmarsh and Keith Bradsher
